title: Force on electron in electric field

content.description: The figure shows a region of uniform electric field with magnitude <math alttext="0.2 newton per Coulomb" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>N/C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, represented by the vertical electric field vectors. The dashed horizontal lines represent lines of uniform electric potential.
content.question: What would be the magnitude and direction of the force exerted on an electron by the electric field?

choices.label: <math alttext="8.0 times 10 to the power negative 19 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>8.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>19</mn></mrow></msup><mtext> N</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, directed upward

<math alttext="8.0 times 10 to the power negative 19 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>8.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>19</mn></mrow></msup><mtext> N</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, directed downward

<math alttext="3.2 times 10 to the power negative 20 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>3.2</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>20</mn></mrow></msup><mtext> N</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, directed upward

<math alttext="3.2 times 10 to the power negative 20 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>3.2</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>20</mn></mrow></msup><mtext> N</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, directed downward

content.answer: <math alttext="3.2 times 10 to the power negative 20 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>3.2</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>20</mn></mrow></msup><mtext> N</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, directed upward

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
